application

Class CustomObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.CustomObject

  • public class CustomObject
extends java.lang.Object
    A custom format for objects. Contains both rendering information (faces, vertices, textures etc), meta data (name etc) and physics information (position, rotation etc).
    Author:
    Sam Dark

    • Field Summary

      private int vertexNo
      The position of the objects vertices in the vertex list
      private static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Vertex>> vertices
      Vertices of the objects, static to reduce memory for objects with identical vertices

      • rotateAboutPoint

        public void rotateAboutPoint(Position relativePoint,
                             double xRot,
                             double yRot,
                             double zRot)
        Rotates the object about a point given an x axis rotation, y axis rotation, z axis rotation and the position of the point relative to the object. Unsure if working or not, experimental.
        Parameters:
        relativePoint - The point to rotate around relative to the object
        xRot - The x axis rotation
        yRot - The y axis rotation
        zRot - The z axis rotation

      • updateMatrices

        private void updateMatrices()
        Updates the transformation matrices. Called after a position or rotation change. Also updates center of mass

      • getCenterOfMass

        public Position getCenterOfMass()
        Gets the center of mass of the object in actual space, not relative to the object. (Calculated as if each vertex has equal mass and nothing else has mass)
        Returns:
        The center of mass of the object

      • setCanMove

        public void setCanMove(boolean inpMove)
        Sets if the object can move or not. Set to false for objects that shouldn't move. This is for things like walls and floors so they don't get effected by gravity
        Parameters:
        inpMove - True or false

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()
        Can the object move true or false
        Returns:
        true or false

      • move

        public void move(double time)
        Moves the object according to its velocity
        Parameters:
        time - How much time to advance the object by

      • postCollisionMove

        public void postCollisionMove(double time)
        Moves the object according to its velocity. Doesn't update the previous position and rotation
        Parameters:
        time - How much time to advance the object by

      • accelerate

        public void accelerate(double time)
        Accelerate the object by a certain time peroid
        Parameters:
        time - The amount of time to accelerate the object for

      • acceleratePosition

        public void acceleratePosition(double time)
        Accelerate just the position of the object by a certain time
        Parameters:
        time - The time to accelerate for

      • accelerateRotation

        public void accelerateRotation(double time)
        Accelerate just the rotation of the object by a certain time
        Parameters:
        time - The time to accelerate for

      • undoPosRot

        public void undoPosRot()
        Reverts the position and rotation of the object to its last update

      • undoVel

        public void undoVel()
        Reverts the velocity of the object to its last update

      • relativeCenterOfMass

        private Position relativeCenterOfMass()
        Calculates the relative center of mass of the object assuming mass only comes from vertices and each vertex has equal mass
        Returns:
        The relative position of the center of mass
